question.title: Question
question.description: In a blood smear of a patient with mononucleosis syndrome, which type of cell is predominantly observed due to hyperactivation?

option_a.title: Option A
option_a.description: Neutrophils are predominantly observed, indicating a bacterial infection.

option_b.title: Option B
option_b.description: Eosinophils are predominantly observed, suggesting an allergic reaction or parasitic infection.

option_c.title: Option C
option_c.description: Hyperbasophilic lymphocytes are predominantly observed, indicating mononucleosis syndrome.

option_d.title: Option D
option_d.description: Basophils are predominantly observed, indicating an immediate hypersensitivity reaction.
